channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: More than 200 scientists say there is evidence the virus could be spread by tiny particles in the air, causing the WHO to review their concerns.
item.title: WHO reviewing scientists' concerns over airborne spread of COVID-19

item.description: Jeffrey Epstein's long-time confidante has been transferred to New York to face charges that she recruited women and girls, one as young as 14, for him to sexually abuse.
item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell moved to New York jail for Epstein-related sex abuse charges

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: The office of Premier Gladys Berejiklian was told about a confidential offer to the City of Parramatta for funding from a community grants program to settle a legal dispute.
item.title: NSW government offered council grant funding to end legal action

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: Data compiled by the Herald shows a swing of 76 penalties in favour of visiting sides while crowds were axed from NRL games.
item.title: Home truth for refs: Study shows huge penalty swing to away teams while crowds absent

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Users of a common health supplement have been increasingly experiencing loss of taste, leading some to wrongly believe they have COVID-19.
item.title: Side effect of common health supplement causes coronavirus concerns

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: A plan to bring international students back to Queensland is almost ready as UQ urges the state government to make it known that Chinese students are welcome.
item.title: Plan to bring foreign students back to Queensland almost final

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: A policy to welcome Hong Kong’s high-quality talent will be inherently a self-interested one of national gain.
item.title: Australia set to join 'the greatest human capital harvest in recent memory'

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: A broader and higher GST would raise enough for states to ditch poor taxes but low income households would have to be properly compensated.
item.title: Bigger, broader GST could be offset by luxury taxes: PwC analysis

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Victorian Liberal Tim Wilson tops the list of MPs who spent a total of more than $400,000 on flags. And that's before we even get started on paper.
item.title: MPs fly the flag – and we pick up the tab

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: The NSW-Victoria border will remain closed until the rising number of cases in Melbourne is brought under control.
item.title: 'Unprecedented': NSW-Victoria border closed by coronavirus with police on frontline

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Tuesday, July 7

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Investor confidence in clean energy has bounced back, led by interest in NSW's new renewables zones, while the boom in solar rooftop installations shows little sign of tapering off.
item.title: Renewables confidence rises as solar boom shows no sign of fading

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: Victoria's free TAFE program will be expanded, with 10,000 more places created in fields the Victorian government says will help the state recover from COVID-19.
item.title: 10,000 new free TAFE places funded as part of COVID-19 recovery plan

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Labor is calling on the Morrison government to urgently fund a $500,000 program to make sure Australians who don't speak English as a first language understand vital information during the coronavirus.
item.title: 'Confusion and misinformation': Labor wants more health translation services for multicultural communities

item.dc:creator: Andy Marks
item.description: Inner Sydney deemed that western Sydney – the country’s fastest growing and most culturally diverse region - could not be trusted as primary custodians of a bold new Powerhouse.
item.title: In Sydney's west we know all about getting a good haircut, and the Powerhouse backflip fits the bill

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: Universities are for the first time offering students early entry based on their year 11 work from this year.
item.title: Early uni offers to target students disadvantaged by COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Jenna Price
item.description: The Boe Pahari debacle has brought renewed focus on the group but has an even bigger challenge.
item.title: Male Champions of Change has an image problem

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Viral video sharing platform TikTok is fighting back against calls for it to be banned amid data security concerns.
item.title: TikTok on thin ice as Parliament prepares to pore over app

item.description: With Victoria struggling to contain the COVID-19 outbreak over the past week, the NSW government should have closed the border sooner.
item.title: Premier should have acted sooner on Victorian border

item.dc:creator: Brian Toohey
item.description: The Morrison government keeps stressing that we share many common values with India but not China. This claim doesn’t square with reality.
item.title: Drop the pretence when it comes to India

item.description: Shortly after his parents won the lottery, eight-year-old Graeme Thorne was abducted on his way to school. He was never seen alive again.
item.title: From the Archives, 1960: The Graeme Thorne kidnapping case

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Tuesday, July 7

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, July 7, 2020

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: The chief investment officer of Australia's largest super fund says the pandemic has accelerated a shift to digital that will overhaul the standing of the ASX's biggest players.
item.title: AustralianSuper exec warns 'climate laggards' will wither on ASX vine

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: The Today show cut ties with Senator Pauline Hanson on Monday after she said residents in public housing were "drug addicts" and "alcoholics".
item.title: Brooke Boney slams Pauline Hanson and laments 'distraction' of statue wars

item.dc:creator: Nicole Precel
item.description: As 22-year-old Rory Smith's lungs filled with blood, an expert crew from Ambulance Retrieval Victoria worked to organise a complex, fast-paced mission to save his life.
item.title: Rory thought he was healthy, then suddenly he was about to die

item.description: Instead of being supported, my community has been confronted with force.
item.title: Housing estate lockdown: What happened to 'together'?

item.dc:creator: Clay Lucas
item.description: MSS Security, one of three security companies linked to the coronavirus outbreak in quarantine hotels, also provides guards for the North Melbourne and Flemington public housing estates now under a hard lockdown.
item.title: Security firm had guards at hotels and locked-down housing estates

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: After Victoria's 'second surge' intensified on Monday with 127 new cases, including infections on the border, NSW Police will soon blockade every access point between the states.
item.title: No way out: Victorians barred from NSW after record infection day

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Australian MPs could cast their votes in Parliament over video conferencing as coronavirus lockdowns continue in Victoria.
item.title: Federal Parliament prepares for virtual sittings in case of further COVID outbreak

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: New rural health commissioner Ruth Stewart is calling for measurable, short-term health targets to close the almost 10-year average life expectancy gap between Indigenous and non-Indigenous Australians.
item.title: Commissioner calls for targets to fix Indigenous health 'disaster'

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: Doctors working in major Sydney and Melbourne hospitals have accused administrators of "bullying" those who demand protective masks.
item.title: Doctors 'bullied' by hospital administration for asking to wear masks

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: The Australian biotech giant will launch a US study testing whether a treatment candidate helps treat COVID-19 related pneumonia.
item.title: CSL kicks off US trial for COVID-19 treatment

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: The staffer worked at the Bourke Street office for the past week and contact tracing is under way.
item.title: NAB staffer at Docklands office tests positive

item.description: Santa can't take the heat.
item.title: A Christmas conspiracy

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: The three men from Sydney's south were retrieved from the water but they were unable to be revived on Sunday.
item.title: Police appeal for public assistance following drowning of three men after boat capsizes

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Jason Gilmore has seen some excellent players come through the nation's pathway systems but had a warning for anyone making early judgments.
item.title: 'Don't judge them like veterans': Junior Wallabies coach on nurturing Australia's next generation

item.description: The 40-year-old left work to go to a fast food restaurant when violence allegedly broke out on the street. Police are still looking for two women who helped him.
item.title: Paramount manager dies after Northbridge street violence

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: This was a good time for Melbourne to leave the state. Even at a time when Victorians are as welcome in New South Wales as cane toads it would still be preferable to being Melbourne in Melbourne right now.
item.title: 'Horrible': Demons in disarray

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Another nightmare for Victorian teams came to a head on Monday when it was announced the NSW and Victorian border would close on Tuesday at 11.59pm.
item.title: Families of Rebels players in limbo as Victorian teams hit road

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: The decision to blast rock was made to reduce excavation time, a Cross River Rail spokesperson said.
item.title: Sirens' call as Cross River Rail enters explosive new phase

item.description: Emergency services were called to Long Street at Smithfield about 11.30am on Monday, but despite the efforts of paramedics, the man could not be revived.
item.title: Man dies on construction site in Sydney's west

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: An impatient Indian board says it can’t wait any longer to plan this year’s Indian Premier League as the axe hovers over Australia’s doomed men’s Twenty20 World Cup.
item.title: Axe set to fall on T20 World Cup

item.dc:creator: David Estcourt
item.description: Business owners bracing for a hit to their bottom line have criticised the Andrews government's handling of the Victorian-NSW border closure, saying they weren’t consulted.
item.title: Border businesses decry closure as new COVID-19 cases emerge in Albury-Wodonga

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Brad Donald believes rugby sevens stars like Charlotte Caslick and Ellia Green would only benefit women's rugby league, but insists they won't have it all their own way.
item.title: Sevens code-switchers won't find NRLW easy, says Jillaroos coach

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: The principal of NSW's Moama Anglican Grammar School, whose staff and students come largely from Echuca in Victoria, says it won't be able to reopen unless they can cross the border.
item.title: Moama school principal says hard border wall would force remote learning return

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Veteran half looks set to be overlooked for a fourth straight week as the Wests Tigers express interest in Canterbury's Adam Elliott.
item.title: Benji to be snubbed again as Tigers show interest in injured Bulldog

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Victoria recorded 182 new coronavirus cases over the weekend, placing nine public housing towers into total lockdown and two more suburbs under stay at home orders.
item.title: As the day unfolded: NSW-Victoria border to close as Victoria records 127 new COVID-19 cases; Australian death toll hits 106

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: Residents in non-lockdown suburbs are self-imposing their own restrictions, such as cancelling visits to loved ones, for fear of catching COVID-19.
item.title: Residents in non-lockdown suburbs self-isolate for common good
